resources.string: Welcome to the Welsh Walks app - your personal guide to experiencing the beautiful walking trails that Wales has to offer.

To help you with your choice of walk, photos, points of interest and attractions relating to each walk have been included. Once you have completed a walk you can add your own attractions to the digital map and save your personal walking statistics.
This app tries to cater for all abilities by offering walks of varying difficulties.
If at any point you need help or guidance on the use of the application you can find the help page in the menu options.
Instructions on the use of each feature are listed below.
This page describes the purpose of the application. To see the whole content of this page you must scroll down the page.
Scroll page up – swipe screen downwards.
Scroll page down – swipe screen upwards.
Enter the application - click the Enter Welsh Walks button at the bottom of the Welcome Page.
Navigate through the application using the three tabs which are - Choose Walk, Map and Details.
Chose a tab – click on the required tab at the top of the page.

This tab consists of a list of walks. Each item in the list has basic information about the walk it’s associated with, which are - the walks name, length and difficulty rating. Each item is selectable and when selected it should navigate you to the map page where it sets the view at the location of the starting point of the walk, marks the path along the walk, shows information points along the walk and shows the markers pointing at nearby attractions. Only three walks are implemented at the moment which are – Llangennech, Swansea Bay and Pen Y Fan. The others will be implemented in the next update. For now these unimplemented walks simply show the message ‘Coming Soon’ on the screen.
The digital map consists of several markers, each indicating different information. The markers are explained below.
Blue dot – This indicates your current position.
Blue Marker – This indicates the starting position of the walk. The blue colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – easy.
Red Marker – This indicates the starting position of the walk. The red colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – medium.
Purple Marker – This indicates the starting position of the walk. The purple colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – hard.
Light Blue Marker – This indicates the position of an attraction.
i Marker – This indicates an information point. These points are only located along the path of the walks.
P Marker – This indicates the position of a car park near the starting point of the walk.
Blue lines – These indicate the path of the walk. The blue colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – easy.
Red lines – These indicate the path of the walk. The red colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – medium.
Purple lines – These indicate the path of the walk. The purple colour indicates that the walk has a difficulty rating – hard.
The instructions on the use of every other feature available on this page are listed below.

Change view type – firstly open up the menu by pressing the menu button on your phone. Then choose one from the four possible view types by clicking the corresponding menu item. The view types are Normal, Satellite, Hybrid and Terrain. The initial view type is set to Normal.
Zoom – at the bottom right of the screen you can zoom in by pressing the ‘+’ button and zoom out by pressing the ‘-’ button.

View current position – there is a button at the top right of the screen which changes the location of the view to your current position. Your last known position will be centred in the middle of the viewing location.
Show walk information – click one of the coloured markers to set the path, information point and attraction markers to be visible.
Show information point details – simply click the i marker. This shows a picture taken from that exact point and information about that point along the walk.
Get attraction’s name – click on the light blue marker and it shows the title of the attraction.

Add your own attraction – press and hold down at the position you would like to add a marker until a message box appears. Here you can add a title to that marker by clicking the empty white box and typing in the text using your keypad. Finally click the ‘create’ button to add and save a light blue coloured marker to the digital map.

Delete an attraction – firstly press any light blue marker so that it shows its title then click on the title to delete the marker. Any original marker deleted will reappear when the digital map is loaded again, however if a marker previously added by yourself is deleted it will be permanently deleted.
Here you can add and/or update your personal walking information. Input the distance walked to update your current saved details.

Update statistics – firstly click on the empty grey box and type in the number (km) you have walked and would like to add to your saved details. When entered click the ‘Update Statistics’ button to update your statistics.
Reset Statistics – to reset your saved details so that the distance walked and the number of walks taken is equal to 0 simply click the ‘Reset Statistics’ button.

This page consists of the digital map; an explanation of the possible interactions can be seen in this video directly below. To start playing the video, click on the black box once to open the play/pause menu then click the middle ‘Play’ button. When playing the video it can be paused in the same way.
Navigate to previous screen – press the back button on the phone.
Open menu – press the menu button on the phone.
